alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:15PM EST until December 21 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot River at West Enfield. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, High flows on the Penobscot River cause backwater effects upon several streams and creeks resulting in lowland flooding between Greenbush and Milford. Properties along the Penobscot River could have impacts on outbuildings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 8.9 feet. - At 16.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 20.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 06/03/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 515 AM EST.
